Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Feb 10th”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great staff, close to airport, about a 1 1/2 or 2 miles to the strip, and free internet. My only complaint is it is located across from a fire station. We checked in around 1:00 AM and from 2:00 AM until 5:00 AM you could hear rather loud sirens every 20 minutes, once that stop all we heard were doors slamming. When I checked out the next night I mentioned it to the staff and they would have gladly moved us to a different room, we were just to tired to complain. When checking in ask for a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: Nice big rooms..very clean. Has a very reasonably priced diner..we ate breakfast which was fine. Has a little bar, no casino. They offer shuttle service to strip for $7 a day per person..we were there only a day so we walked..it was far!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: JaisMom
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for a really good deal through hotwire. Staff was friendly and check in was a breeze. The rooms were nice. It a bit small. Clean and comfortable though. Rooms were decorated in a contemporary style. We never ate in the restaurant. The parking garage was clean and well lit. I liked the location being off the strip. Nice restaurants close by. We actually stayed in one night and ordered buca di beppo's. The only complaint I had was one night there was lots of bumping and thumping over my head (which I can't fault the hotel for). All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Groupon-Including Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: densweenie
Reviews.Content: We purchased a two night stay through groupon and stayed at the hotel between Christmas and New Years. We were told that the deal included a full breakfast for both mornings which had a value of $10.95 each. The cost of the groupon would have been a pretty good deal with those 4 breakfasts included. What a joke of a breakfast. The price on the menu for the complimentary value breakfast was no where even close to $10.95 and you had no options of what to order. The hotel rooms and hotel were quite nice but the location was not the greatest and definitely did not feel safe for walking at night. I thought the hotel was overpriced even with the groupon deal. We would not stay there again. Oh and as many others have said, my husband tore his ankle up on the corner of the bed too!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: djones021708
Reviews.Content: was accused of smoking in a non smoking room even though when we entered the hotel the hallway reaked of smoke. Argued with manager who kicked us out and got charged 150.00 even though they had no proof it was our room. when I asked to get a signed copy of me authorizing the charge, manager said he would email it.... of course i never got that email. never staying at a holiday inn again.... FYI if it smells funny, check out and cancel your card so they cant charge you for it !

Reviews.Title: “New, Affordable, Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tamaracedre
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way back from the Grand Canyon...Clean, Comfortable, STEAL of a deal on Hotwire (blind auction @ $40 a night). Excellent for a good night's rest near the strip and basic accommodation for sightseeing. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “New, quiet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: laurelboo
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. We were on the end of a 3 week vacation, and had been in all kinds of hotels-- including three others in Las Vegas. This was one of the quietest. The bed was very clean and comfortable; we had a nice view; it was sharply decorated. The staff at registration was courteous and helpful. They printed directions for us to go to a local church on Sunday, and to beautiful Red Rock Canyon the next day. We liked it's location off the strip, and liked the fact there were no nearby casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: SLOTRAV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at this place and it was great. Fairly modern rooms, fast wifi, and very clean feeling. Sadly no free breakfast. Booked on Hotwire for an incredible price. Friendly staff too for a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Good off-the-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZCasualTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Las Vegas is about 2-miles east of the Strip so you will need a car or opt for the shuttle (fee-applies) to visit the Strip. This Holiday Inn provides free parking in their gated-garage for those with a car. The overall facility cleanliness is very good and the rooms were clean as well. Free Internet access, pool and gym all on-site. There is a restaurant on-site as well which we did not try because there are so many other restaurants in Las Vegas. This Holiday Inn restaurant appears more like a hotel lobby than a restaurant, so the ambiance there is not great. The Holiday Inn Las Vegas does provide good clean rooms, reasonable rates, and a quiet off the strip but close to the strip location to enjoy the action in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Deal....enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Al P
Reviews.Content: From the outside it was really non-descript. The inside lobby was just fine however and the front desk staff provided quick and easy check-in service. The room was both clean and comfortable. I liked the secured parking garage. All in all it was a nice overnight weekend stay. Close enough to the strip to drive over in less than 5 mins. Nice to be off the strip for a little quiet, good relaxation and no extra resort fees. Check-out was also seemless.

Reviews.Title: “were we at the same place..”
Reviews.Author: dutch83
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night my family and I from the beginning not really impressed checked in with no greeting and instructions for my stay just got the credit card keys and off we go at night used the jacuzzi really cold did not want to complain but if outside its 55 degress put it a little hotter please key s to reenter room would not work faulty credit card reading due to worn out cards but nice and proffesional lady helped us in with new cards. in the morning went to forte retaurant sat down for 10 minutes my family and me nobody cared to even come and help us we left and went to the strip which is not walking distance about 2 miles area is shabby pros.. free shuttle service from airport locked and covered parking kids 12 under eat free with paying adult rooms small but nice great maid service

Reviews.Title: “Free shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: brucejkirch
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas for buissness frequently and I am not a gambler. This newer property has a great added feature- FREE SHUTTLE FROM AIRPORT! This is great, no need for expensive taxi or long lofg waits for the shuttles that go to all the casinoes. The rooms are nice and the breakfast is good. The Holiday inn also has a feature that will shuttle you back and forth to the casinos for a very small fee (love it!) taxis can add up quickly in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay and the staff exceptional...”
Reviews.Author: Annette B
Reviews.Content: We were only in Las Vegas for 3 days/nights but what a gem we found 1 mile off the strip. The entrance wasn't exciting as they didn't have much "bling" identifying the hotel but the lobby, restaurant/bar and guest computers were very nice. The room was adequate and we didn't pay for coffee!! I left a tip for the maid and asked for more pool towels but she took the money and never gave me the towels. The best part of this hotel was the staff that helped get us to/from the airport and the strip. One of our drivers, James, did an awesome job in not only getting us where we needed to go and picked up (very timely too) but also gave lots of suggestions that made our visit very enjoyable. Thank you James and the rest of the team at The Holiday Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet non casino place abroad from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dirk W
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in Palos Verdes Road is approximately 1,5 km located from the strip. It is small and offers only a minimum to the guest. The hotel has no restaurant just offers a bar, a simple breakfast for extra charge and a simple room service where you can order soup, salad and burgers. We had a room for handicapped people, as I am sometimes in a wheelchair, the room had no window and also no mobile phone connection. Further the hotel has no casino and is really quiet. As club members we got free Wifi internet which made the whole stay comfortable, the bed is huge they have a small heater and the bathroom is easy but good enough. But you want to be in the action area - you can be there fast. They have a shuttle service bringing you free of charge to any location at the strip - unlucky you - when it just left. In this hotel stay a lot of airline crews but also people who have an own car. We chose the place as we are members of the Holiday Inn Club and we could use all our collected points. Further we wanted it calm. So we really liked it and made friends with most of the stuff there. When there was no shuttle service available we could also use the public bus station which stopped about 150 meters far from the hotel. A seven eleven is not too far, another 100 meters. The pool we couldn't use as the time we chose for our stay was December and it was damned cold we also had snow! Nevertheless the staff is very helpful especially when tipped off. And we liked that place. Compared with luxurious places at the strip I would rather stay again at this place as I prefer the calm and quite atmosphere and security of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie948
Reviews.Content: My room was ready, clean and had a great view of the strip lights at night. The desk clerks were very friendly and the shuttle drivers were just great. They do have two shuttles and I never had to wait over 15 min. for a pickup. This Hotel has no casino or slot machines. It is very quiet and a welcome resting place after a hard day at the convention and strip.There is a restaurant and a small bar. If you rent a car there is ample free parking in the attached parking garage.There is a convenience store within walking distance as well as a 24 hour CVS drug store about 1/2 mile away.The casino across the street has a great buffet and restaurant and all of the gambling you would want.It was a great place to stay and I will stay there the next time I go to Las Vegas.This is the Holiday Inn at 4055 Palos Verdes Street.

Reviews.Title: “keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: Hart S
Reviews.Content: should of slept in my car. carpets are very dirty and worn, bath rooms need a good scrubbing (not to mention that they are not stocked very well,) staff is indifferent and seems that for the most part they are doing you a favor by allowing you to check in. breakfast is till 11 but dont even think about asking for coffee at 11:15. was told by one clerk that "this is a privately owned hotel and they can do what ever they want"! so much for the brand! house keeping is slow and not responsive to special requests (extra pillows) and the sound of slamming doors all night just adds to the experience. i spend 100+ nights a year with this chain and this location is so far below the standard that i have come to trust, i cant believe this facility still carries the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that delivers what it promises”
Reviews.Author: DerFotograf
Reviews.Content: This hotel does a suberb job of providing exactly what it promises. The room was clean and comfortable and wi-fi worked flawlessly. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great room. Great location bad location.”
Reviews.Author: nthnycooke
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful brand new hotel. I was extremely impressed by the professionalism of the hotel staff. The location is great because it is close to everything but far enough from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas lights. I am a Las Vegas local and I used it as a romantic get away with my wife and we found it very comfortable. The room was extremely clean and the parking garage is enclosed. I only have one negative review. The neighborhood behind the hotel is less than to be desired. Definitely not the place you want your car to breakdown in the middle of the night. But as far as the hotel itself I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven away from Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: arriveanddepart
Reviews.Content: While some prefer to be in the thick of the brilliant lights, over-the-top glitz and dizzying spectacle of the Las Vegas strip, I opted instead to settle a mile or so east at the Holiday Inn Las Vegas – Flamingo during my recent three-day stay. I enjoyed this vantage point from beginning to end! The five-story hotel is new, clean, quiet, away from the madness, and in an off-strip area of good restaurants. The lobby and rooms are HGTV-style in contemporary interior design and décor. Most of all it was convenient to the University where I attended a conference.But after each one of my conference days, I returned to my hotel and checked e-mails and social media at the Holiday Inn free business center. Hardly anyone else was there. Then, after a bite to eat, I took the hotel’s free shuttle to and from the strip to check out how Vegas has drastically changed since my last visit years ago. The hotel staff and shuttle drivers are friendly, authentic and couldn’t do enough for me. Since this hotel is relatively new, not many people yet stay there, so I received special treatment and quick service at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandracarte
Reviews.Content: This was a very plesant surprise. we only booked for one night. it was our last night and i wished we had styed here the whole time. it was close to everything, And it was the very best price we have ever had for a hotel stay.Such a super value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alf T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, the staff is full of wonderful people and is new. The rooms are just as you see them on the pictures. Breakfast is deluxe! Very convenient shuttle service with drivers willing to serve. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, we have been in two famous hotel of Vegas and although they cost triple this hotel rooms are far better and as it is a small location makes of it a very comfortable, friendly and nice. Alf

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you have a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: ladylovesrome
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn. They have plenty of underground parking which is nice. In a car, it's minutes from McCormick and Schmick's (which has a great Happy Hour) and the strip. All the casinos have free parking so you can have fun and come back to a nice, fairly quiet, smoke-free room. I also like that you can take the elevator from your room floor directly to your car (skipping the lobby). Breakfast was expensive so I recommend going to Denny's on Maryland, it's less than 2 miles away. There's no tub in the room. There's a large flat screen with hardly any channels (no accurate channel guide and no premium channels). Unfortunately, there's no central air. Instead, there's a wall unit air conditioning. It's loud and comes on and off all night. You also aren't getting much ventilation in the restroom. Also, the fitness center had no air so it was closed. But overall, it was a nice hotel. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: YvetteC1331
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was better than I expected for the price, and the staff was super friendly. The shuttle service is 3$ for duration of stay and really saves if you're on a budget. Shout out to: Donald George Stephanie DJ Daniel Arnyne and David! staff was particularly personable and helpful to me during my week stay on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you want to be off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lynnmelin
Reviews.Content: nice hotel ,staff was very friendly, clean(hallway a little dirty),quiet, only issue we had was that the maid took our dirty towels but didnt leave us clean ones...had to go to desk to get clean ones...we rented a car , but they do have a shuttle, good underground parking..you had to swipe your hotel card to get into the garage and hotel after 10 pm...lots of store and eating spots very close and a small casino across the street...they have a small resturaunt in the lobby food was OK ...we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “South of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2teens
Reviews.Content: The title of this hotel is Las Vegas Strip, Not exactly. There was a nice view of the strip from our room. The area around the hotel is a little shady, but the hotel is nice. There is a (Free 6' 6" clearance) parking garage under the hotel that locks at night. Our stay was good, beds clean and comfortable, room very clean, staff friendly and helpful. I would not recommend walking to the strip through the surrounding neighborhood though.

Reviews.Title: “Cost = Value”
Reviews.Author: LibryLdy
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to stay in this hotel -- not in all the action, but not far from the action. I was there for business, and would recommend this hotel if you need to plan a conference -- plenty of meeting rooms. My room was very comfortable, and getting a cab into the main strip was easy. It was a while trying to get on an airport shuttle; there weren't enough running for the demand, but that wasn't the hotel's fault. Overall, what I paid for the room was definitely equal to the value of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Dan717
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Its not far from the strip, not really in walking distance, but they offer a free shuttle. The shuttle doesn't run all night, however I don't remember when it stopped. The hotel is brand new, rooms are spacious, free WIFI, free parking, a pool, and a gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean place to stay near the strip”
Reviews.Author: jhammil
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline on this hotel. Great clean and modern. You can walk across the street to Roy's. A fantastic Restaurant. It is a straight shot to the strip so you can drive down and park at one of the casinos for free and walk the strip before coming back to some peace and quiet at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean three star Holiday Inn hotel....”
Reviews.Author: 747alika
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, and furniture was modern but poorly designed and uncomfortable. Bed stand wood corners protrude out at ankle level, ouch! Firm mattress, but the pillows are very lumpy and too soft, even the ones marked FIRM. This is a Holiday Inn trademark at every property. Lot's of bad spill stains from previous guests on carpet that could not be cleaned. Very unforgiving carpet choice. Free underground parking was a bonus in the Nevada desert heat! Caution! Stalls are very narrow, with lots of pillars, drive slowly. Lone window has no sheer drapes to filter light through while allowing privacy from outside. Only option is to close pull down blind, blocking all natural light. Two elevators for seven floors are very slow, so make sure you are patient. Avoid rooms overlooking the pool area due to excessive noise from guests, music speakers, and the busy fire department right across the street. They had eight emergency calls on our first night, with sirens going off hourly until 410am!! We listened to poolside guest normal conversations until after 10pm, outdoor music until midnight when I finally had to call the front desk to turn off the pool speakers. We moved to the otherside of hotel with no view for quiet. No, breakfast is NOT automatically included. It depends on your room rate package, if it includes breakfast, so make sure you choose the rate plan that offers breakfast and one beverage choice. Limited menu from 0630-11am. No buffet, set menu only. Wait staff seemed rushed, overwhelmed, dirty coffee cups and utensils from previous diners stayed on our table the entire time. The check was placed on the table with our meals, and the server never returned. I recommend getting a Terrible's Casino FREE BUFFET coupon from the lobby tourist rack. Terrible's Casino is right across the street, with a good buffet restaurant. On coupon is another coupon for a FREE Cap or T-Shirt and $5 slot free play when you open a free players club card. You will need the card to redeem the buffet coupon. We collected our free t-shirts, used the $5 slot free play after you add at least a dollar to the machine with your card. Cheap fun at Terrible's! Breakfast buffet is $3.99, lunch $5.99, dinner and sunday brunch only $8.99. Use the coupon for 2-4-1 buffets! One guest at the pool bragged that she got the Holiday Inn Las Vegas using Priceline for only $50/night for her entire week stay. Another guest used Hotwire website for a low rate. I used the regular Holiday Inn website for my higher rate (sigh). Also, you get nothing extra as a Gold or Platinum level Priority Club member. I am a Platinum level member and was "pre-assigned" to a small room 321, next to the ice machine and elevators, with a view of a wall, the loud pool music speaker and directly down at the busy hot tub, listening to guest conversations all day. Fire department sirens all night long. We had to move rooms after the first night. No pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Rainbow at the end of a bad trip start”
Reviews.Author: AKHILLDIRT
Reviews.Content: My trip started out with delayed flights and missed connections because of the delays. When I finally got to the Holiday Inn, the Desk Staff, Mark and Katie, were awesome and very professional. I had a small issue with the reservation but CID the Operations Manager addressed the issue in a friendly and professional manner (very impressed with his demeanor). Then Jeff the Food and Beverage Manager kept my sister and I laughing thru the check in process. By the time I got to my room I had forgotten about the beginning of the trip. I totally relaxed after a bad start. The room was great very clean and the bathroom very spacious. They also have a Casino shuttle and the driver was very prompt and gave us tips on where to go and where her pick up points were and also the number to call when we needed a pick up. That was nice because then you don't have to worry about being at a certain place and a specific time. All in all when I left I was totally relaxed, rejuvenated, revitalized, re. re. re… I think you get the idea : -) and will definitely stay there again and I highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but a Little Remote”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Swan29
Reviews.Content: Hotel is plesant enough with good-sized rooms but is much further from the Strip than we expected (a good half-hours walk). Location is very quiet and deserted, pool is good and there is no gambling on-site, a real plus as we were travelling with our two children (10&13). We had the breakfast coupons included in our rate but they let us order anything we wanted off the menu with no extra charge - maybe a perk of being PC Platinum! Shuttle was very good - we used it to go to the Strip twice and the airport but got taxis back because they only collect you from designated points. Would stay at the hotel again if we get back to Vegas with the kids but if we travel as a couple would prefer to try one of the Strip hotels to get more of the LV experience.

Reviews.Title: “New, Just off Strip and way better service”
Reviews.Author: FamilieHotello
Reviews.Content: After one night stay on the strip we found all we were looking for in this brand new Holliday Inn Hotel (flamingo) Rooms are new and up to standards, Windows could have been a bit bigger to my taste. Beds are heavenly, the little chair looks nice but is not too comfortable. Bathroom was clean and spacious. The pool area is fresh and nice and included a small hot tub. As it is on the 2nd floor terrace it tends to be a bit windy, Breakfast from the menu was fine. Staff was very surprised I asked for cappuccino and none of the three waiters knew ho to make one, so they let me help myself. Not very professional but fun. The girl at the reception was friendly and professional. Transportation to the strip by the concierge was a great service. Good place close to the strip and way better rates and more personal service!

Reviews.Title: “Safe but Isolated”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Flamingo Las Vegas-Room 320, Dates of stay 26-29 May 2011. We arrived after 10pm so no free shuttle from airport. Taxi was about $15 with tip. Check-in with Jeff was easy. He changed our room from a king to two queens. There is no advantage being a Priority club member as there are no upgrades because there are only two types of rooms. The website mentioned executive floor but nothing such exists according to one of the front desk guys. We had breakfast included-not a $10 voucher as advertised but a coupon for an entrée and one drink (juice or coffee but not both). Room was ok with view towards vacant lot so quiet. A/C worked well, nice tv with limited channels. Comfortable chair with lamp in corner. Light bulb replaced in lamp between beds as requested. Bathroom nice with low tub-easy to step out of. Toilet didn’t always flush on first try. Shampoo, cream, soap provided and ok. Plenty of towels. Shuttle was ok and usually available but only to preset locations. We would take to strip and then wander back on foot. Usually stopped at Tuscany on the way back. Terribles nearby but very smoky because of poor ventilation. I won’t return there again unless staying within area. No complaints with front desk staff. For breakfast, try to get lady. One older man seemed bothered to serve and took 3 requests to get ice water. One younger guy was ok but lady was the best. We didn’t use the pool or exercise room but did print out boarding passes for our return flight. They stored our luggage since our flight wasn’t until 5 pm. Great shuttle ride to airport. Biggest scare was waking up at 3 am with no electricity. It was dark since there was no emergency lighting in room. Phone didn’t work so I used cell phone to call front desk (fortunately, I had called when we were to arrive late so number was still in recent call list) Nice lady said whole block was out but not sure why. I was a little concerned because who would notify us if we had to escape. No lights so there would be lots of people in underwear or less evacuating! After about 45 minutes, electricity came back on so just a false alarm. One strong recommendation: The Envy Steakhouse at the Renaissance for Sunday brunch. $29.95 includes bloody Mary station, wines, and French champagne plus omelettes and other breakfast selections, prime rib, shrimp, oysters on half shell, split crab legs, cheeses, desserts, and more. A Liberace type piano player with several older women made even more special. Have the shuttle take you to the convention center and walk back. We took the shuttle to the Venetian and walked and walked but found it and had the best Sunday brunch ever. A definite must do on the next trip. I would probably not stay here again unless I got a great rate or couldn’t get one elsewhere. Most staff were nice, hotel was clean, but location was not the best. Stay here if you just need to relax or want to get away from crowds. Shuttle makes a very positive statement if you don’t arrive too late to use it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: lilyruo
Reviews.Content: I ordered the room from hotwire at $35/night. Definitely a good deal. I've been to holiday inn a couple times, and this one is by far the best. The whole place is fully renovated, my room is big and clean, with large 35inch TV and large bathroom. They have underground parking space so save us $20 in parking on strip. :D Free breakfast till 11am. Also free shuttle to strip. I will definitely go there next time, and next time I won't even rent a car. plus quite with out crazy drunk ppl walking around. :D highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallas77_11
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at another hotel in the heart of the strip. We were unhappy and paid quite a bit of money for a two night stay. We checked out and found the Holiday Inn, it is east of the strip. There is no gambling at this location. The room were CLEAN and the furniture is modern & had a 42" Sharp Aquos Plasma. The staff was very friendly, and they have laundry facilities. They also offer a shuttle to the strip If I visit Las Vegas again I would without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, clean.”
Reviews.Author: BigFatTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, beautiful, and clean. The beds were very comfortable but the main design flaw was having a large square wooden rim around the bed - sounds fine but I defy anyone to stay there and NOT bruise your legs on it at least twice a day! Apart from this however, the room was great with a large flatscreen TV. The location was fine - approx 10-15 minutes walk from the Strip. There is a free hotel shuttle, but I am not sure this is reliable - we telephoned Reception to book our ride to the Strip but when we got downstairs we found that the shuttle had left to take someone to the airport. Breakfast is provided depending on what rate you paid. We did not have breakfast provided but it is not difficult to find somewhere to eat in Vegas! Overall I would recommend this hotel and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, peaceful, hotel: Off the strip; Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: soundnlights666
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn after I was unsuccessful getting a decent priced room on the strip... The hotel was super cute. And cheap... But best of all...The employees there were STELLAR... \ You could tell that they were struggling because they were totally sold out, but they did their best, and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one! I enjoyed my stay, and would recommend this hotel to others. It was a buy for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “ThankGod its over”
Reviews.Author: AnirudhJhunjhunwala
Reviews.Content: We approached this hotel after passing through the strip and were disappointed at the gloomy, dead look and approach to the hotel (as compared to Terribles, right opposite). The lady at the reception allocated the 3 of us in a small, cluttered room where we kept hurting our shins with the edges of the bulky excess furniture. After we had enough of bruises and the disappointment from the layout of the room, we made our minds to check out the next day to a better hotel. After letting the reception know about this, we were moved to a room with wheelchair access, which was MUCH bigger. My question: Why the hell didnt you give us this before. The bell boy who was helping us move was very friendly and kind. He seemed to know that the service in the hotel was pretty bad as compared to the other Holiday Inn hotels. The breakfast was NOT a buffet as we thought. It was wholesome but Id prefer more variety in a buffet. I really cant understand why they do something unconventional like this. Overall, as a platinum member I will make sure that I never stay at this location ever again. The reason is not just the ugly and cold approach road and the building but also the yellow swimming pool and lack of knowledge of enhancing customer experience by providing good service. Bursars were pretty fed up of the instructions that were given to them for the breakfast and they were also trying to run away from serving us (even though there was no one else to serve). We felt very un wanted and felt that our first trip to Vegas was ruined because of a bunch of careless people who are incompetent at managing a hotel. They never have people for room service. They really didnt care. Its a shame!! Avoid if possible!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for 3 nights. Las Vegas is no place for kids but this hotel helped us see the sights whilst keeping them away from the serried side of the city. Service was generally good though breakfast was always a struggle. Why they insist on table service rather than provide a simple buffet is beyond me! staff were fre Is sly and helpful, there is plenty off free parking, a shuttle bus to the strip and free wifi which helps planning a family day out. Hotel is about a year old and room are small but nicely decorated if cluttered with too much furniture. Cleaning was ok but behind a chair in our room was thinck with dust. G Overall good family hotel with pool and at sensible rates

Reviews.Title: “great compromise”
Reviews.Author: chelseaprice
Reviews.Content: The good: great price, rooms are modern but not sparse, free shuttle service with a smile, staff very nice, beds amazingly comfortable, crazy quiet The bad: lobby and hallway carpets stained, room is small for more than two, you will bump your shins on metal bed frame a million times The ugly: we had a horrible view of a vacant lot and run down apartments, not safe for walking alone outside after dark Overall: we would stay here again based on the great quiet night sleep we got and caring staff. This is an average hotel for low-rollers like us

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - made my day!”
Reviews.Author: mcnovak
Reviews.Content: My letter to this property after my stay: My name is Mark Novak, and I travel for business about every other week. While traveling on business February 21st, air traffic was disrupted by a large snowstorm that blanketed the upper Midwest, causing flight delays and cancellations and rerouting hundreds if not thousands of travelers. I was one of those unfortunate people who were caught in the middle, dealing with long lines, cranky people and unusual circumstances as I tried to get from Minneapolis to Salt Lake City. After seventeen hours and several changes in my itinerary, the closest I could get to my destination was by making my first-ever trip to Las Vegas, arriving after midnight and leaving early the next day to get to Salt Lake City - late for my business meeting. I caught a cab at the Las Vegas airport, and the driver attempted to find his way to the Holiday Inn on Palos Verdes - he didn't have much luck, and actually called the dispatcher and the hotel for directions before finally finding it just after 1:00 am on the 22nd. I was exhausted by my seemingly endless day of travel, had no luggage, and just wanted to get a nap before starting over again in a few hours. I paid the cab driver too much money and entered the hotel lobby. The desk clerk, Donald, alerted of my arrival by the can driver's call, was ready for me. He was warm and friendly as he greeted me, happily provided toiletries to get me through until my luggage could find me, offered information about the return trip to the airport, and took my wake-up call request, all very efficiently and in a manner that I was grateful for after a trying day. I was in my room by 1:15. A few hours later, my 5:00 am wake up call was prompt, and Donald was still cheerful and helpful. At my request, he called a cab company that took credit cards, offered me a cup of coffee, and chatted with me while I waited for my cab to arrive. As I got in the cab, he thanked me for my business, and wished me luck on my travels. While the trip was ultimately a successful one, it had started by going form bad to worse - until your desk clerk changed my attitude by presenting his own positive attitude and cheerful outlook. I would like to take this opportunity to let you know I appreciated the hospitality, and would like you to pass this "thank you" on to Donald for helping me make a bad day better. I have not maximized my stays at Holiday Inns in the past, instead I have stayed in higher-end properties with stuffy, unfriendly employees much too often. If your front line employees are anything like Donald in Las Vegas, you will get more - and keep more - of my business and the business of my partners and associates. Thank you, Holiday Inn, and Thank You, Donald!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable place to stay, watch out for the bed frame!”
Reviews.Author: NativeGirl47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days to attend a conference. The hotel is off the strip but there are lots of dining options within walking distance - Bahama Breeze, Gordon Bierch?, etc. Easy location to drive into. Love the parking under the hotel - very safe, gate closes after 10 pm and opens with room key. Check in was fast and convenient, employees friendly. Our room had a "view" of the strip, but also overlooked an empty lot full of trash. We didn't mind. We didn't pay for a view. Thought I should note this anyway because some people might not care for this type of view. Our room was a standard size. Huge TV, but downside was there were no pay per view movies available. The room was nice and quiet until the last night there, we had neighbors (a bunch of loud partying kids) and you could then tell how thin the walls were. But the noise was before 9 pm, so we didn't make a big deal about it because they left by 9:30 pm. You can hear people walking in rooms above you too. We are heavy sleepers, but light sleepers might want the top floor. Beds/bedding was sooo comfortable. Bathrooms were modern and clean. Everything worked great. The building seems new - everything smelled new. Overall we really like the convenience of the place. Less traffic being away from the strip. You definitely need a car to get to the strip unless you are in good physical condition -a walk! I do have one complaint about the room. The bed is placed on a dark wood base which sticks out 2" further than the bed on all three sides. Oh my gosh. My husband and I are bruised on our shins from running into the wood corners of the bed. We stubbed our toes on it. When the comforter hangs over the bed, you cannot see the dark wood frame sticking out. I ran into it during the night and getting ready in the morning numerous times. Very very painful. After the 2nd day, we put both trash cans on the side of our bed to remind us to steer clear of the corners of the bed. The 1st night my husbands phone was ringing. He got up to run to get his phone, ran into the wood corner of the bed which tripped him. He fell and suffered a rug burn on his knee and a bruised shin. That's when the trash can "guards" went up. Housekeeping would move the trash cans when they cleaned and bam! we would run into the corners again. Ouch! It's the bright white comforter over the dark wood frame. You really cannot see the base until it's too late. Overall, everything else was really great. We would probably stay here again next time. We stay in hotels 5-10 days a month. We're not picky guests, and this place worked fairly good for us!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pelusetta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday inn in February to attend a convention in las Vegas: it was a good bargain, out of the crowd but connected with a shuttle at request. Rooms are very large, soundproof and very well cleaned. Everyone we met has been very gentle, professional and always available to reply to our request. The hotel is brand new!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn....da hood!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelmaster69
Reviews.Content: Then again, what part of Las Vegas near the strip ISN'T a little shady? We walked from the hotel to the strip about 11pm and we were relatively safe. I didn't get stabbed, shot or assaulted even once while I was there! All kidding aside, overall I think this hotel is not a bad option for some folks. The hotel itself is pretty nice, modern and clean. I found the beds comfortable and any noise from the airport is no big deal, it did not slow me down from sleeping. The staff were very friendly and accomodating...with a very easy check-in. Staying on the strip, the check-in can sometimes take 40 minutes. I was checked-in under 5 minutes.The parking garage is right underneath the hotel and was very convenient. If you have a car or rental car, it is not a bad choice...especially if in town for business. You avoid all the hassles of the crowds on the strip yet you are only 1 mile from there. You can walk or take a taxi, taxi ride for those looking to indulge in some beverages and not drive will run about $8-9 to go straight over flamingo to the bill's gambling hall taxi which is the closest spot to get out on the strip. Now, if you like to just go downstairs from your room and gamble or walk the strip, you will not like it. Although, "Terrible's" Casino is right across the street. The restaurant in there is pretty cheap and it is an acceptable place to make a gambling donation...but don't expect much eye candy, hit the Hard Rock for that (about 1/2 mile up Paradise)...OMG, sensory overload. Terrible's is your basic hangout for locals or those who are on there last nickel. But back to the review! I found the restaurant to be good, clean and relatively inexpensive for breakfast, by vegas standards,,,about $8. We even had a nice strip view at night, of course during the day you can see the surrounding neighborhood and it is a little rough. All in all, if you have a car, go for it...you can certainly do worse.

Reviews.Title: “As they say location is everything”
Reviews.Author: BoiseID999
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel, underground parking. Comfy beds but watch out for the box the matress sets on, I hit my shins many times. Right across the street is a large fire station so all day & ALL night sirens are going off. It is extremely loud and if you are looking to relax and sleep this is deinately NOT the place to stay. Will all the selections you have in Vegas, avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Southwest Airlines cleared for takeoff on runway 1L”
Reviews.Author: thedude_888
Reviews.Content: The only thing wrong with this hotel is the noise from the airport. The builder, architect, whomever, just really made the wrong choice on window materials+ design. The plane noise during the day is 1 plane taking off approx every 8 minutes. The hotel is close to the airport so the planes are only about 1200 feet above the building; but what exacerbates the noise issue is the way layout of the building makes the worse then it actually is- catching it like a parabolic. This is not an exageration- if 2 people are talking in the room with the TV on- the planes will interrupt like a person snoring in the room. But if you are outside on the street, or in your car, you do not notice the jet noise as much. This may be IChotels worst hotel for that fact. On another note: The jet noise is only during the day, you do not notice it at night. Other than the jets, noise is not a factor & is a peaceful place. Aside from that, the staff is very nice. Cleaning crew good. All other factors- No Problem- Holiday Inn professionalism through out. Rooms look like they were designed by Bob Guccione. If noise isn't an issue, please consider this hotel. It is a great location for business if you are working a convention at LVCC. Personally I put up with the noise because I got a Hotwire deal on this. For the money I paid, it was still worth it noise & all. I would not have been happy paying full rate for this. I am giving this a thumbs up in recommending this hotel because the jet noise is not the staff's fault- I blame the architect and the builder. IChotels needs to fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: annieinla
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were traveling north and decided to stay in Vegas for two days. Unfortunately the first day fell on Christmas Day and major hotels on the Strip were bit too pricey, so I gambled and booked this Holiday Inn which was about a mile away from the Strip. I've been to Vegas many times but never stayed at a hotel which is off the Strip and didn't know what to expect. Luckily once you pass the Las Vegas Boulevard, it only takes about 2-3 minutes to the hotel. There are many popular restaurants around there, including my new favorite, Firefly. The garage had the gate which made me wonder if the area was not safe or I should be looking around when we unload our luggage but that was the only part that made me feel a tiny bit uneasy and everything else was great. Unlike those Vegas hotels, there was no waiting line to check-in and the young guy at the front desk was very pleasant. The room felt like it was still new and we thought it was a decent size. Oh, but I kept hitting my feet to the bed frame. Overall, everything was clean and new except the bed sheet. When I opened my comforter, it had wrinkles like someone was sleeping on there already. I checked the pillows and they looked clean and didn't smell anything and I was too tired to call the front desk and wait for someone to come and change it so I've decided to ignore it. I went to sleep right away and heard nothing but my sister said many people came back to their rooms after midnight and got pretty loud. She said she thought someone was in our room talking. Next day, I was able to enjoy my favorite TV channel on a big flat TV while my sister was able to check her emails for free. We knew we'd sleep in late until we had to check-out so didn't bother to ask if we get the free breakfast as some of those Vegas websites stated but I think I've read we could get complimentary coffee in the morning at their cafe. We were going to shop whole day so we moved to a hotel on the Strip next day, but when I come to Vegas by myself, I often go to places off the Strip and don't need to stay at those pricey major hotels. Especially, many hotels nowadays have been cutting down many amenities anyways (do you remember we used to get stuff like cotton swabs, shoe polish clothe or mending kit?) but adding ridiculous Resort Fees for nothing (this past year, I've stayed at Mirage, Treasure Island, Venetian and Planet Hollywood which recently stopped charging the Resort Fee). I didn't feel like I downgraded and stayed at a cheap motel. It was nice that there was no awful smell of smoke to go through when you come back to the hotel or stupid Resort fee to pay but got a free internet access with many good dining places to choose from. I'll definitely stay here again (but I will call the front desk if I see wrinkles on my bed sheet next time).

Reviews.Title: “Used hard and worn out fast - management that doesn't care”
Reviews.Author: IndyTravelerX
Reviews.Content: Shuttle service runs when it wants to, don't expect a pickup during the posted hours. Housekeeping does crappy service, and seems to forget basic things (at check in we had a half empty lotion bottle with tissue stuck to it in our bathroom) each day it was something different (no shampoo, no soap, no conditioner). Front desk is argumentative and not helpful. Restaurant is expensive and only open for dinner on some weekends, they were closed when we were there even though it was during the posted open hours the specials board was sitting out like it was open, and the hotel was sold out??? We left a voicemail, and asked for a call from the general manager to discuss our concerns, but did not recieve a call back. Obviously no one here really cares about the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: OregonTourist
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel a year ago when it was new. Unfortunately, a year later it already appears much older than it is. It is not being maintained well. The hall carpets are stained, the elevator buttons broken and doors scratched. Wallpaper in the bath was starting to peel and the white grout in the floor was black with ground in dirt. Also on one morning of our stay the "hot" water in the shower was only tepid. In addition I would not recommend the restaurant, we had breakfast there and the food was mediocre at best. On the positive side it is convenient to restaurants and the strip, plus the secure parking is nice. Also the short walk to your room without having to trek through a smoke filled casino is a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braden1776
Reviews.Content: Gated parking garage, very friendly staff, and very comfortable room. Free internet and free shuttle to airport or strip. A few blocks off the strip this new hotel served us very well and with 2pm late checkout you can sleep off the night before. Priceline $40 Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and secure parking”
Reviews.Author: RCantarelli
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel close to midnight after a night out on the strip, we actually thought the place was closed because the parking lot was dark and there were no cars or visible signs. Then we realized that there is a parking garage that is only able to be opened at night with a room key. Kind of nice to know that your car is in a secure area, unlike some of the hotels in the area. The room is very nice and clean and the staff was all very friendly, something that I can't say for a lot of other hotel staff in the area. The bed and pillows were extremely inviting and comfortable. We will stay here again for sure! We also liked having in room coffee for the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe (sharp metal edges) Bed Frame”
Reviews.Author: JDHood
Reviews.Content: Spoke with hotel staff about metal bed frame that extends beyond bed matress. This alone creates a tripping hazard HOWEVER the corners of the metal frame don't join smoothly and leave a gap. A sharp two point edge. I know they hotel has received other complaints about this very issue. It is dangerous as an adult; unacceptable as a parent.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: N8pilot
Reviews.Content: I am a pilot and our company puts us up here. It is away from from the strip which is nice to get some good sleep. But it is also not far from the strip so it is good alternative. Several places for dinner within walking distance. Clean rooms, good service. The shuttle can be a little delayed sometimes. Secure parking lot. Breakfast is good. Dinner is alright. Walk or drive to other places for dinner. Holiday inns vary a lot, but this is one the better ones we stay in. Recommend a room facing away from paradise avenue for a nice and quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: Brand new Holiday Inn. Even seemed to smell new. The decor in the lobby was so stark that it seemed like they were still working on it. Very cold looking. I guess that is ultra modern or something. Service was top notch by all employees. Music was loud in the lobby that people seemed to be yelling when talking to each other. Good area not that far off the strip. Lots of restaurants all around. The only thing that seemed strange was when I pulled my car up to the garage at night to park, the gate was up and I couldn't pull in. I had to leave my car and go into the lobby and ask what was going on. They told me I had to put my keycard through a slot in the driveway which I had trouble finding. Just annoying. I guess they must have some problems in the area with all the tight security but then again it is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogercambs
Reviews.Content: Being off the strip we were a bit conerned about getting aorund. Needn't have worried, the shuttle was great, we used it a few times and the worked really well for us. The drivers never took long to pick us up and they always make Airport pick ups and drop off's a priority. The Hotel is new and NOT glitzy but the rooms are good an clean, breakfast wasn't expensive so we didnt need to look for a cheap alternative. On word of caution, watch the beds!!!, the wooden surround at the bottom sticks out and my wife and still carry the scratches!. The staff are friendly and genuinely seem to care about making your stay pleasurable. I'd give them a 9 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money, but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: LesAlanos
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasent experience and we would probably use the facility again, but there are as many areas for improvement as there are good points. In summary: Check in: We were kept waiting whilst the Receptionist was on the phone which wasn't the greatest start. Room: The room quality was excellent, the beds comfortable, and the bathroom clean, and functional. The downside was that the air conditioning was very loud. That said the noise drowned out the traffic noise. :) Service: On two occasions we got back to the room at 4pm with it still to be cleaned. The bar also closed at 10pm, with no drinks available on room service. The Breakfast service was however excellent. Facilities: Whilst it was too hot during the morning, and early afternoon we did use the pool later in the afternoon and early evening. The pool itself altough not too big was a nice to have in the hotel. Restuarant: We ate breakfast here on three occasions and were pleasantly suprised by the Quality and service. We didn't eat at night, but did partake in the happy hour which was good value. Location: We personally had the use of car and the location off the strip suited us. Overall: We would stay again, the Hotel is new, but needs to get the Service levels up to speed, particularly in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: truetous
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very comfortable. Had a large, comfortable bed. Location was easy to find and not having to drive into city centre is an advantage. Free internet access. Reception and concierge could have been more helpful in finding tickets to shows, room service etc. Took 6 calls to reception to order food in the room. Overall, good hotel but other hotels in the city centre offer much better value for money. This hotel is located some distance from the strip but charges more than many of the high end hotels on the Strip. However, in terms of luxury it is nowhere near the other hotels. Checked with reception to try and find show tickets. Was advised to check directly with the shows. Receptionist did not even have an idea about show timings. Overall, has potential to do much better. Was I unhappy? No. Would I stay again for the same price? No. Would I stay again for half the price? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BCC1972
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Solid, clean rooms. Nice sized LCD set. - Strong WiFi, though the business center is nice too. Had to use it to print off boarding passes for departing flight and it worked well. - Very friendly and attentive staff, from the front desk to the small bar/restauraut that was on site - Secure underground parking. Though I didn't use it myself, I would've found it useful. - Shuttle service til around 10pm. No pickup service, which stinks, but local bus route runs near hotel and gets you to/from strip in five minutes. Bus service runs often enough as to be convienent. The "bah" : - Not the greatest location. Fire/Ambulance depot across the street can be loud at times. - Do wish the rooms had blackout curtains - No fridges in the rooms, which would have been nice. Not a major issue, but would've been nice. Would stay there again next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You have got to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Shymerlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel had only been open for approx 6 months when our family stayed for 3 nights. It has underground parking which is secure for approx 100 cars. The rooms are fantastic and immaculate and could not fault them at all with having 2 Queen size beds which were very comfortable. Its about a 20min walk to the strip but the hotel does supply a free shuttle to the strip but not return trip. I used the shuttle a couple of times and the driver was more than accomodating even taking us exactly where we wanted rather than the pre organised drop off points. However its just as easy driving yourself if you have a car and leaving it in any on the strips hotel carparks which are free. I found the value of the hotel unbelievable and would have paid more. I had a couple of tiny issues in that the toilet blocked and the staff were very helpful and said dont worry we will sort this for you immediately - they didnt and it cleared itself after a while. The bar seems to shut really early as returned one evening at approx 10.30 and it was closed and no-one around. Also breakfast service can be SLOW - on our last morning it took 30mins to take our order then another 20mins to deliver it albeit incorrectly. I think some of the staff are new hence these issues but dont let it deter you from staying here as I would without hesitation stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and neat but slightly inconvenient.”
Reviews.Author: graeamos
Reviews.Content: Opened for only 5 months, it is a very new different Holiday Inn. The style is clean, modern and simplistic --- nothing extra. The location of the Holiday Inn on Palos Verdes Street is 1 of 3 total near the Vegas strip, and the one most taxis do not know where it is, so be prepared to say your address and give them directions. While the hotel offers a shuttle all day long (5-15 minute waits), it does not do pick-ups, so that extra money you saved by getting a hotel further away from the strip goes to paying for the taxi rides every night. Advice --- better to pay the extra $10-$20/night and get a more convenient hotel closer to the strip. The hotel shuttle drop offs at three major locations: MGM, Venetian and Flamingo, which are all decent places to start walking to your next destination. To walk at night to your hotel is not recommended, even though taxis rates are high compared to New York and Atlanta. The taxis are overall friendly and can recommend several places to go and things to do. I would suggest to the hotel that they offer shuttle pick-ups for certain times 9pm-11pm, it would certainly help as visitors who stay there will be happier with the easier convenience and the hotel could make a bigger name for itself since it is not located on the strip. Or offer cheap $5/flat rate fees for pick-ups, it's really inconvenient compared to other hotels. The hotel is located almost in the middle of nowhere, as of May/June 2010, there is alot of empty concrete ground around the hotel. Close by/walking distance depends on the hot desert air, you can go eat at local restaurants such as Buca Di Beppa and Roy's, none of which I tried. The Holiday Inn has a nice breakfast available at their level floor known as the Forte Grill. They offer a good selection of breakfast meals for a decent price, from omelets to croissants to toast, with self-serve coffee. The service can be slow at time, seems there is only 1 person working and runs around doing all the hotel room services as well. The front desk is next to a open seating area and bar, and behind is a big area for public conferencing or business/computer area. Only 1 computer with USB hub and laser printer is offered, there is a touchscreen that doesn't do anything. I would suggest adding another computer station setup. The hotel is very clean, immaculate is the word, which could either make you love it or hate it. It can seem cold at times, but Holiday Inn is going for the new and hip look, which attracts the under 50 or single visitors in Vegas. Walking around in the morning and evening, you don't see many people, which is nice in a crowded Vegas. It's very quiet, although you are 10 minutes away from the airport. I never heard any bothersome planes from overhead. However, the hotel walls are slightly thin, you can hear the TV from next door at night. The hotel room is very simple looking, ours was a 2 Queen size beds with large cable TV and one small coffee table (with pot & mix), one dresser connected to a long table with a lamp with 2 extra sockets. There's one 1-seat sofa chair and a bedside table with a phone and a lamp inbetween the 2 beds. Overall, I think the beds take up too much space due to the layout, and there could better bright lighting instead of 3 small lamps which you must turn on one by one, and one more sit-in chair/stool would be good. There is a normal-sized closet with an iron and ironing board inside with extra hangers, useful. The bathroom is nicely setup with the basic dryer, towels and accessories, also includes big showerhead nozzle and working vents. The hotel beds are big and soft, which can be good or bad depending on your back. There are 4 large pillows included, 2 firm, 2 soft and a nice bedsheets, although I was allergic to the linen or fabric. Advice --- bring long pajamas. Room service was friendly and quick to answer the phone, however we did ask them to give them to give us a cell phone call when our lost luggage arrived, but they never called. We had to find out later by going to the front desk, however they did leave a message on the phone. OVERALL RATED " B" GOOD --- clean, free internet, no smoking, no casinos inside, not crowded, friendly service, free shuttle drop-off, nice breakfast (not free) BAD --- far from strip (costly taxis), no shuttle pick-up, bare minimum, slightly slow service/not enough attendees

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: adjasj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and it is fantastic. Beautiful rooms, great parking, and a shuttle to take you to the strip. There is also a great business center, pool and spa. I loved this Hotel. I am a hotel manager and know what great service is... this hotel has it. Alex was especially helpful. He gave me a great room, and went beyond the requirements. Great job everyone!

Reviews.Title: “You had me at NICE SMELL”
Reviews.Author: slyeee
Reviews.Content: The good: Free shuttle pick up from the airport to the hotel (cab fare approx. $20). Excellent front desk. Smells really good. 100% smoke free. Free wifi A MUST! HUGE flat screen HDTV. Bed was super comfy. Rooms are clean. Bathroom is big, so is the room for that matter. Everything is new without the horrible NEW smell. Laundry room. The questionables... Plastic disposable cups vs. glass cups (holiday inn, not holiday inn express, right?) Possibly located close to a fire station? (i heard fire sirens every single night) + AC was a bit loud. Thankfully, I had ear plugs. :D i win. Few missing items from housekeeping (extremely minor details) No fridge to keep my fruits and waters cool. Overall, the hotel is extremely nice. I rather stay here than the Bellagio (because I actually stayed at the Bellagio after staying at the Holiday Inn and while the hotel was nice, the rooms were outdated, the tv was small in comparison to the Holiday Inn)

Reviews.Title: “nice new hotel- but a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: dowers
Reviews.Content: As others have said this is a brand new hotel (was told it has been open 4 months), so the rooms were very nice. The staff were very friendly. Another great thing is that there is a free shuttle. Initially I was going to rent a car but they picked me up at the airport and even drove me to the convention centre- so I saved money on having to rent a car. But take note that the shuttle does get full and sometimes you have to wait a while for it. I did try eating at the main lobby restaurant once- had a really good spicy hamburger. The only real downside of this hotel is the location. It is a pretty long walk to the strip, and coming back at night a couple of my taxi drivers didnt know where it was until I mentioned that it is near Terribles. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: beansandgert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my 7 month old baby. The rooms were beautifully done with a large flat screen TV, good bed linens, big shower, contemporary furnishings, good view of the UNLV campus, and lots of storage room. I had a minor emergency at midnight and called to the reception and they were able to get the ambulance to me immediately and the manager came up to make sure we were OK and that we had everything we needed to get the hospital. The young lady at the reception was a pleasure and was very caring with my daughter and me. There is lots of underground parking and a new lounge/resto that offers limited fare. Best hotel in Vegas for the non-gambler just looking for a nice place to stay. On a small down note, the AC is a little loud.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel, not bad”
Reviews.Author: herminator
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before leaving for the airport this past weekend. I stay at alot of Holiday Inns across the country and this is a newer property with some nice features. The rooms are comfortable, bathroom large, flat screen TV and comfortable bed. There is a lounge restaurant on the main floor which I did not use so I cant comment on that. It is a mile off the strip so dont think its close by. Terribles is across the street if you want a near by casino and Hard Rock is a block south. (Blocks in Las Vegas are not standard city blocks, they are much longer) Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and its near the airport. However you are also on a flight pattern so the noise of jets taking off is constant and loud. Also for some reason the shuttle company I purchased a round trip ticket from for the airport will not pick up at this property so I had to meet them across the street at Terribles casino for pickup. Take away the noise of the jets taking off and being a mile off the strip I might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: elekat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this brand new hotel for just about two weeks. What can be better than new clean rooms & bedding? King beds have shower & no tub with a bit larger room, queen beds have shower & tub with rooms a bit smaller. Free parking, restaurant & pool. Coin laundry on 3rd & 5th floor. Although not much time was spent in the room, we considered this a great place to stay. Rooms facing Flamingo could be noisy at times as emergency vehicle are located across the street.

Reviews.Title: “At long last - Vegas has a Holiday Inn again”
Reviews.Author: al4175
Reviews.Content: Had a last minute change to my plans and decided to get to Vegas a day early. I was pleasantly surprised to find there's a brand new Holiday Inn and I was able to use my points. It's located a short block off Flamingo between Buca Di Beppo and Roy's. The Holiday Inn is essentially at the back of the Candlewood Suites property on Paradise, for those who are familiar with where that is. Easy parking, they've got an indoor garage. You can take the same elevator from the garage right up to your room's floor, a nice touch. Very pleasant front desk personnel. Room on the somewhat smallish side. Bath quite large but only a large shower, no tub. My only real concern was the heating/AC unit - quite noisy. Had breakfast in the lounge/restaurant Saturday morning and I was the only customer. Really good omlette and service. As others have stated an easy walk to the Hard Rock, which I did. I would definitely consider staying here again in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great staff and free champagne!”
Reviews.Author: J-L-1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of the year. It's a new hotel and that can't be beat. New beds, new pillows, new bathroom. Is a good option away from the crowds and noise of the strip. The staff is attentive and care about all the small details. We had champagne for 13 at check-in and then 2 more rounds while we were making plans at the lobby. They close the parking gate at night and that makes you feel safe. The zone where the hotel is located is kind of lonely at night. If you want to go tho the main strips hotels and casinos, it is a very long walk but they shuttle you from free to the strip. The free internet was really fast. I had some trouble with my key because it needed to be re-programed on their system but otherwise everything went perfect. I would recommend this hotel to people whose main interest is not gambling... if it is, you should stay at a casino.

HotelInfo.Name: Blackstone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4055 Palos Verdes Street, Las Vegas, NV 89119 (Formerly Holiday Inn Las Vegas)
